ygData.subject: Re: The Soerbaird
ygData.msgSnippet: Jythri, I am new to the Bard Guild and have not heard of any such group to join, I am a Wood Elf Bard and already have 3 of my five songs, would I be
ygData.messageBody:
Jythri,
I am new to the Bard Guild and have not heard of any
such group to join, I am a Wood Elf Bard and already
have 3 of my five songs, would I be compensated for
those if I decided to join (other songs or resource).
Where are you located and are there other Guilds out
there to join for Bards?

Andriah (a new voice in the choir)

--- Randy Varnell <rvarnell@...> wrote:
> From: Randy Varnell <rvarnell@...>
>
> Ralborn:
>
> I appreciate your concern, and I know that ten
> platinum is a hefty sum.
> But, as I responded to you privately, the funds are
> not misused nor are
> they squandered. Running a guild has its expenses,
> especially if we are to
> provide collective services for our bards so that
> they might carry on their
> work with honor and dignity.
>
> As I mentioned to you before, lad, we provide the
> following services to our
> members:
> * Patchwork armor for all new students
> * The first five levels of songs for all new
> students
> * A hand drum at level 5
> * A lute at level 8
> * Bi-weekly rewards for the best in-guild ballad
> or writing. This week
> it was a Banded mail tunic.
>
> Also, we use the money to pay for other expenses,
> including:
> * Staff for concerts
> * Saving for a guild hall
> * Prizes for other Soerbaird events
>
> We do not use guild money for:
> * Buying better armor or equipment for guild
> leadership
> * Bribing news sites for better placement
> * Paying necromancers to destory anyone who
> speaks negatively
> about The Soerbaird
>
> For the public record, all of our staff, called
> Ollave, have more than paid
> their ten platinum, without a complaint, and most of
> them continue to
> contribute into the guild treasury on a daily basis,
> in order to benefit
> our students. I have seen several of them give the
> shirts off of their
> backs and the weapons from their fists to help a
> deserved student in need.
>
> Doerbaird, before you sally our guild's reputation
> again in a public forum,
> I would respectfully request that you air your
> differences with me, as I
> will be happy to hear any problem you have with our
> guild.
>
> Listen and Live.
>
> -- Jythri, Pencerdd of The Soerbaird
>
>
>
>
> >From: Joe Racke <joe_racke@...>
> >
> >Is it just me or is Soerbairds guild a rip off....I
> really want to know
> >why the heck it costs 10plat plus a monthly fee to
> join...thats a load
> >of Bull crap.....I was going to join but then i
> found i had better
> >things to do than pay to those greedy rogues....If
> you give me enough
> >information on that guild and why it costs so much
> then i might join it
> >until then.....keep begging Soerbairds.
> >
> >
> >This is Ralborn Songbearer ending his song
> >
> >Ralborn
> >Bard of Qeynos
> >follower of Bristlebane
> >(also in his world)
>
>
>
